title: Research Beads JSONL format
description: Document Beads schema, field mappings to Taskulus, what gets lost. Design migration strategy.
notes:
Plan: inspect local .beads JSONL schema and document fields relevant for migration; record findings and close.
Inspected .beads/issues.jsonl schema. Top-level fields observed: id, title, description, status, priority, issue_type, owner, assignee, created_at, created_by, updated_at, closed_at, close_reason, notes, acceptance_criteria, dependencies, comments. dependencies[] objects: issue_id, depends_on_id, type, created_at, created_by. comments[] objects: id, issue_id, author, text, created_at. Timestamp formats: issue created_at/updated_at include offset (e.g., 2026-02-10T23:20:19.698014-05:00); comment created_at uses Z (UTC). .beads/metadata.json maps database and jsonl_export; interactions.jsonl currently empty.

title: Performance benchmarks for indexing
description: Create benchmarks: 1000 issues, measure index build time, cache load time. Must meet targets: Python <50ms, Rust <1ms.
notes:
Plan: 1) Locate existing benchmark tooling. 2) Add minimal benchmark harness for index build and cache load using 1000 issues. 3) Document targets and run results. 4) Wire into tests if appropriate. 5) Update task and close.
Implemented benchmark harnesses: tools/benchmark_index.py and rust/src/bin/index_benchmark.rs. Normalized cache mtimes to 6 decimal places in both implementations to avoid precision mismatch. Ran benchmarks: Python build ~66.34ms, cache load ~7.58ms; Rust release build ~51.06ms, cache load ~5.71ms. Targets (Python <50ms, Rust <1ms) not met yet. Tests: python -m pytest python/tests/test_cache_serialization.py, cargo test.
Added benchmark instructions to README: run python tools/benchmark_index.py and rust cargo run --release --bin index_benchmark.
Switching focus to performance improvements within scope. Next: profile index build and cache load to identify hotspots without changing behavior.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Profiling: isolated cProfile on build_index_from_directory and load_cache_if_valid after warming imports. build_index_from_directory ~0.066s for 1000 issues. Top cumulative time: pathlib read_text/open (0.049s), sorting glob results (0.008s), json loads (0.004s), pydantic model_validate (~0.002s). load_cache_if_valid ~0.010s; dominated by collect_issue_file_mtimes (0.006s), pathlib glob/stat, and pydantic model_validate. Next steps: reduce file IO and sorting overhead, consider faster directory scan or bypassing read_text per file.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Next step: reduce sorting overhead in index build by sorting directory entries by filename (not full path) in both Python and Rust for deterministic order with less Path comparison cost. Will re-run benchmarks after change.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Implemented filename-based sorting for index build: Python now sorts issue paths by path.name; Rust sorts read_dir entries by file_name. Benchmarks: python build_ms 58.54, cache_load_ms 6.90; rust release build_ms 50.05, cache_load_ms 5.05 (targets still unmet). Tests: python -m pytest tests/test_index.py, cargo test --test index.

Tests: python -m pytest tests/test_index.py, cargo test --test index.

title: Implement spec parity checking tool
description:
Create tools/check_spec_parity.py to verify both implementations cover the same Gherkin steps.

**Algorithm:**
1. Parse all .feature files in specs/features/
2. Extract all Given/When/Then steps (excluding @wip scenarios)
3. Parse Python step definitions in python/tests/step_definitions/
4. Parse Rust step definitions in rust/tests/step_definitions/
5. Report any steps defined in only one implementation
6. Exit with error code if parity is broken

**Acceptance criteria:** Tool runs successfully on empty step definition files, reports parity status, can be integrated into CI.

**Integration:** Add to Makefile as make check-parity and to CI pipeline.

title: Fix CI badge publishing
description: Fix CI badge publishing failure by generating badges in a separate job and deploying them to a badges branch. Ensure badges directory exists and remove unsupported inputs.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Reworked CI to generate badges in a dedicated job (needs python/rust), create badges directory, and publish to badges branch via peaceiris/actions-gh-pages. Removed unsupported badge-action inputs.

title: Fix CI badge URLs
description: Fix CI badges to use SVG output and update README badge URLs to raw SVG instead of shields endpoint.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Updated CI workflow to write SVG badges and README badge URLs to raw SVG files on badges branch.

title: Generate local coverage badges
description: Compute coverage in CI, generate local coverage badges (Python/Rust) without external services, and update README to use those badges.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Added tools/coverage_badge.py and updated CI to compute coverage percent/colors and publish local coverage badges; README now uses local badge SVGs. Coverage XML not present locally unless pytest --cov is run.

title: Clarify coverage badge labels
description: Update coverage badge labels to explicitly indicate Python and Rust.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Updated CI badge labels to 'python coverage' and 'rust coverage' for clarity.
